How to deal with that feeling?

      some people earn points per letter

11.12.22  4:24 pm   how the heck long is an interior diagonal line of a cube

      let's see..... leg squared plus leg squared equals hypotenuse squared...... so let's start with the square face... call the edge 1. 1+1= hypotenuse squared, so the hypotenuse diagonal across the face is √2. Then i can imagine another right triangle with that hypotenuse, the outer edge of the cube, and the grand diagonal (the one you're looking for). so it should be 1 squared plus √2 squared equals answer squared.... 1 plus (root 2 squared) is 3.... the answer should be the square root of 3. If one edge of the cube is 1, then the grand diagonal should be the square root of 3

      maybe the line is very big, and robust

      that all hinges upon whether or not electricity is real

11.12.22  3:40 pm   do you think americans should say french words like croissant with french accents or should they pronounce them the american way

      saying things with good french pronunciation, especially with the 'r' sound, attracts a lot of attention. and that's simply not what americans want. most americans say they would prefer to blend in, flying just 'sous les radars'

11.12.22  5:04 am   Why do you tend to use less capital letters than most people would use in any given situation?

11.12.22  4:53 am   how to choose between truth or feelings

      impossible. it's always some kind of hybrid

11.12.22  3:17 am   im trying to organize a few hundred sounds by "type", and ive got all the "percussive" stuff on in pile (where the pitch doesn't matter) but i'm not sure what the call the other pile, any good names for non-percussive musical sounds? (pianos, guitars, horns, synths, basses)

      besides drums and perc, the 3 categories i use are 'BASS', 'VOC', and 'NON'. bass means bass, voc means my voice, and non means anything besides voc bass drums or perc. These are the functional categories i use for mixing, and for that purpose the category devisions are nearly rock solid. Within the non, there's always a vague attempt to find some categories for arrangement purposes, but the lines always get blurred and break down and argue about how specific to be or not. lead, pno, rhodes, organ, bell, guit, strings, twinkle, pluck, pad, flute, syn, horn, trumpet, miscnon, ..... as you can see there would be a lot of overlap and many things can be used for both, so there never seems to be clarity on that level. i've noticed the same thing when trying to deal with the categorization of my website. at a certain point you just have to accept that real life ultimately will resist total categorization, yet always seems to invite you to try
